story:
DeviClear is part of:

                                 

A humanitarian effort to bring clean drinking water, sustainable energy and   building materials to communities around the world that so desperately need them.

                                      www.thehumanhandsproject.org


Your purchase of a DeviClear not only gives you pure drinking water but allows us to help those less fortunate in impoverished areas gain access to clean drinking water also – thanks to your generous participation.


                                               DeviClear


The DeviClear Purifier is the FIRST Portable (34oz) UV Purifier to use an integrated activated charcoal and pre-filter cap in one to purify and clean untreated water in 60 seconds.

Not only does it contains a power button lock to prevent accidental use in your bag but it also enables you to charge via USB cable, Wall adapter and through the use of a Solar Panel which is one of the only methods of power you will be able to use if your electricity gets shut off in a disaster situation.

With bottled water and potable tap water so readily available it is easy to take clean drinking water for granted. 

                                      


But when natural disasters strike, one of the first things to sell out on the store shelves is bottled water.

 

                         

         Running water may even be turned off or compromised by pollutants.

Now our bodies are made up of around 60% of water and so we understand how vital it is that the water is clean. 


                      


Domestic water purifying pitches and faucet filters are fine for every day use, but most of them simply weren't designed to filter untreated water like the kind you may need to drink in emergency situations. Unlike those other off-the-shelf, refrigerator sized water filters DeviClear purifiers have actually been designed to purify the water from untreated sources like rain water, streams, dirty lake water and rivers.

They use a much more powerful filtration system that removes harmful pathogenic bacteria, cysts, parasites, and unhealthy chemical contaminants such as chlorine. 

The DeviClear will also destroy the more resistant pathogens like Hepatitis, E.Coli, Salmonella, Legionella, and the Polio virus just to name a few. 

Your ordinary water purifying pitches and faucet filters


                       


                                 were not designed to do this. 

The DeviClear Purifier can be a lifesaver in an emergency but it will also be a great product to use in your home on an everyday basis and a travel friendly water treatment option as an alternative to bottled.


This is how it works:

The DeviClear Purifier uses an activated charcoal filter along with a short wave germicidal UV light, plus a portable solar powered charging kit, making on the go water purification a breeze. 


We've made it very simple....

First you unscrew the cap.


Put in the filter.


The Activated Carbon not only makes the water taste better but it also removes a lot of the impurities and contaminants including chlorine, odors, and pigments.


Pour in the contaminated water.


Screw on the Short Wave Germicidal UV Light cap and press the power button.



           


In about 60 seconds your water will be cleaned, purified and ready to drink.

                                       

                                         It's as simple as that!


Regardless of how clean water may look, any water source could be tainted with microscopic waterborne pathogens that, if ingested could cause severe diarrhea, cramps, vomiting and fever. 

This is why we have chosen to use an activated charcoal filter plus a short wave germicidal UV light as well. It will be twice as effective!



Here's Why...

Activated Charcoal

Activated charcoal is a carbon that has been treated with oxygen. The treatment results in a highly porous charcoal. These tiny holes give the charcoal a surface area of 300 - 2,000 m2/g, allowing liquids or gases to pass through the charcoal and interact with the exposed carbon. The carbon adsorbs a wide range of impurities and contaminants, including chlorine, odors, and pigments.

Short Wave Germicidal UV Light

From research conducted through speaking with experts in the medical field and articles written on the subject, it is a known fact that the treatment of water with short wave germicidal UV light possesses by far the greatest germicidal effectiveness of all ultraviolet wavelengths. This exceeds U.S. EPA guide standards and protocols for destroying over 99.9999% of bacteria, 99.99% of viruses and 99.9% of protozoan cysts. The wavelength range is 2000 to 2950 (Angstrom units) which disrupts the DNA within the bacteria, virus and protozoa rendering them ineffective and, therefore, harmless. 


Using the sun's natural rays to clean water (Long-wave ultraviolet light) will have very little germicidal value as the wavelength range is 3250 to 3900 (Angstrom units).

Using a Middle-wave ultraviolet light which is best known for its sun-tanning effect will provide some germicidal value but only with sufficient exposure.

Short-wave ultraviolet light technology is the best proven method to use if you want to destroy all bacteria in the water, including the more resistant pathogens, Hepatitis, E.Coli,  Salmonella, Legionella, and the Polio virus.


This is our start in the quest of eradicating world hunger and poverty. No more drinking filthy river or tap water, teeming with parasites, bacteria and animal waste. 


                                  

                  Water is a human right, not a commodity! 

 

Donated DeviClear Purifiers will be sent to the places where it is needed the most. This includes:

 India

Most villages in India have inadequate water wells to service the people. Wells installed by the government are shallow in depth, and the water is not pure. As a result the people constantly battle afflictions with parasitic diseases.


Africa (Ethiopia plus many other regions) 

Only 46% of Africans have access to adequate water for drinking and everyday purposes leaving millions of other African residents to suffer annually from diseases. Ethiopian woman and children often walk 6 hours to collect safe water, making school and housework a second priority. 


Asia

Much of the arduous duty of fetching water falls on girls. The tasks are time consuming and very labourious. Woman and girls spend hours walking to the water sources, and their journeys often could be dangerous. When chained to such duties girls are excluded from going to school.


Philippines

Typhoon Haiyan left many in the Philippines without access to clean drinking water. Many are still in need of help.


Haiti 

As the poorest nation in the wester hemisphere, Haiti has to deal with issues of poverty and water scarcity on a daily basis. Only 55.2 % of the population has access to an improved water source, while close to 70% does not have direct access to potable water.

Bettering the world takes people with empathy and the courage to change it. If you want to fight, then why not fight for the voiceless millions that wish they could see another day. It's not enough that we strive to be good people. It is in our struggle to be great that we reveal the importance of other human beings. We can be more than what we are. 

                                                       Hope into Action.

Here is the breakdown for the project. (Scott Koszalinski - Product Developer)

Research and development is expensive.

As you can see from the above fees, that is a total cost of $204,200. This does not include the working prototype (to be discussed), any 3rd party approvals or the disclaimers below. 

However we are just asking that you try to help us to raise just the minimum amount if possible. We would definitely appreciate your support and help with this. There are too many expensive devices out there that many people just cannot afford and we noticed that the inexpensive devices that you can purchase really didn't do the job they were supposed to do to help people. This is why we knew we had to do something about it and create our own low cost unit that actually cleans and purifies the water whilst leaving in the vital nutrients that the body needs. One that a lot more people can afford.


                                 No-one should be without clean water!



Here is what you will receive:

Preliminary Design Requirements: 

1. A portable, 1000mL (34oz) plastic container that is environmentally friendly (i.e. no BPA etc.) 


2. An integrated, Purifier screw on cap that includes:

a. Micro USB Recharging port for use with plug in USB cable that can be used with a wall charger or a solar charger
b. Short-wave germicidal UV bulb 
c. OLED, LED or LCD display screen for communicating information to the consumer. 
d.     Power button to enable the UV cycle to begin 
e. Safety switch to prevent UV light from working when not attached to Purifier Bottle.


3. An integrated, Pre-Filter cap that includes:
a. A minimum of a 100 Micron nylon screen which effectively filters out larger sediment and particulates

b.     Activated Charcoal to filter out Chlorine, odors and pigments
c. Frame that mounts securely over the bottle threads and helps to protect them from untreated water when dunking in rivers, streams, etc.


4. An integrated, standard drinking cap that includes: 
a. “Bite” type valve system for drinking or standard spout 
b. Frame that mounts securely over the bottle threads and creates a leak resistant seal.


5. Portable solar powered charging kit for charging the integrated Purifier cap in the field. This will also charge (any) mobile device you have. 


The Impact

If you think for a moment about how vital clean water is for your own use, you will realize just how important your contributions are.

Imagine the face of a child that now has the ability to have clean water. You did that. You made that smile happen. That child will live another day and become more healthy for what you contributed to. 

                                         

           

                                               Turn Hope Into Action.

The treatment results in a highly porous charcoal. These tiny holes give the charcoal a surface area of 300 - 2,000 m2/g, allowing liquids or gases to pass through the charcoal and interact with the exposed carbon. The carbon adsorbs a wide range of impurities and contaminants, including chlorine, odors, and pigments.Short Wave Germicidal UV LightFrom research conducted through speaking with experts in the medical field and articles written on the subject, it is a known fact that the treatment of water with short wave germicidal UV light possesses by far the greatest germicidal effectiveness of all ultraviolet wavelengths. This exceeds U.S. EPA guide standards and protocols for destroying over 99.9999% of bacteria, 99.99% of viruses and 99.9% of protozoan cysts. The wavelength range is 2000 to 2950 (Angstrom units) which disrupts the DNA within the bacteria, virus and protozoa rendering them ineffective and, therefore, harmless. Using the sun's natural rays to clean water (Long-wave ultraviolet light) will have very little germicidal value as the wavelength range is 3250 to 3900 (Angstrom units).Using a Middle-wave ultraviolet light which is best known for its sun-tanning effect will provide some germicidal value but only with sufficient exposure.Short-wave ultraviolet light technology is the best proven method to use if you want to destroy all bacteria in the water, including the more resistant pathogens, Hepatitis, E.Coli,  Salmonella, Legionella, and the Polio virus.This is our start in the quest of eradicating world hunger and poverty. No more drinking filthy river or tap water, teeming with parasites, bacteria and animal waste.                                                     Water is a human right, not a commodity!  Donated DeviClear Purifiers will be sent to the places where it is needed the most. This includes: IndiaMost villages in India have inadequate water wells to service the people. Wells installed by the government are shallow in depth, and the water is not pure. As a result the people constantly battle afflictions with parasitic diseases.Africa (Ethiopia plus many other regions) Only 46% of Africans have access to adequate water for drinking and everyday purposes leaving millions of other African residents to suffer annually from diseases. Ethiopian woman and children often walk 6 hours to collect safe water, making school and housework a second priority. AsiaMuch of the arduous duty of fetching water falls on girls. The tasks are time consuming and very labourious. Woman and girls spend hours walking to the water sources, and their journeys often could be dangerous. When chained to such duties girls are excluded from going to school.PhilippinesTyphoon Haiyan left many in the Philippines without access to clean drinking water. Many are still in need of help.Haiti As the poorest nation in the wester hemisphere, Haiti has to deal with issues of poverty and water scarcity on a daily basis. Only 55.2 % of the population has access to an improved water source, while close to 70% does not have direct access to potable water.Bettering the world takes people with empathy and the courage to change it. If you want to fight, then why not fight for the voiceless millions that wish they could see another day. It's not enough that we strive to be good people. It is in our struggle to be great that we reveal the importance of other human beings. We can be more than what we are.                                                        Hope into Action.Here is the breakdown for the project. (Scott Koszalinski - Product Developer)Research and development is expensive.As you can see from the above fees, that is a total cost of $204,200. This does not include the working prototype (to be discussed), any 3rd party approvals or the disclaimers below. However we are just asking that you try to help us to raise just the minimum amount if possible. We would definitely appreciate your support and help with this. There are too many expensive devices out there that many people just cannot afford and we noticed that the inexpensive devices that you can purchase really didn't do the job they were supposed to do to help people. This is why we knew we had to do something about it and create our own low cost unit that actually cleans and purifies the water whilst leaving in the vital nutrients that the body needs. One that a lot more people can afford.                                 No-one should be without clean water!Here is what you will receive:
Preliminary Design Requirements: 
1. A portable, 1000mL (34oz) plastic container that is environmentally friendly (i.e. no BPA etc.) 

2. An integrated, Purifier screw on cap that includes:
a. Micro USB Recharging port for use with plug in USB cable that can be used with a wall charger or a solar chargerb. Short-wave germicidal UV bulb c. OLED, LED or LCD display screen for communicating information to the consumer. d.     Power button to enable the UV cycle to begin e. Safety switch to prevent UV light from working when not attached to Purifier Bottle.
3. An integrated, Pre-Filter cap that includes:a. A minimum of a 100 Micron nylon screen which effectively filters out larger sediment and particulatesb.     Activated Charcoal to filter out Chlorine, odors and pigmentsc. Frame that mounts securely over the bottle threads and helps to protect them from untreated water when dunking in rivers, streams, etc.
4. An integrated, standard drinking cap that includes: a. “Bite” type valve system for drinking or standard spout b. Frame that mounts securely over the bottle threads and creates a leak resistant seal.
5. Portable solar powered charging kit for charging the integrated Purifier cap in the field. This will also charge (any) mobile device you have. 
The ImpactIf you think for a moment about how vital clean water is for your own use, you will realize just how important your contributions are.Imagine the face of a child that now has the ability to have clean water. You did that. You made that smile happen. That child will live another day and become more healthy for what you contributed to.                                                                                                    Turn Hope Into Action.

story:
A Few Weeks Till Greatness

 Hope all is well,

The goal is to get $2300 we can do it with your help! You can help me in anyway you can either by donating or spreading the word thank you all. 


Love, Edwin


About Edwin


My name is Edwin Navarrete and I am a college soccer player from Escondido, California. Since college season was over I have been training consistently for my summer trials in the field and in the weight room.
I played for Santa Ana College where we finished 3 in State out of 322 college in California. My position is right back or defensive midfield. I was #5 in SAC in which I started every single match. Meeting some people there I was able to get a trial in August with  professional soccer teams in Mexico and El Salvador.

This puts me in a difficult position, I need help funding my expenses to Mexico and El Salvador to be able to focus on my dream and what I have been working so long for of playing professional soccer.

With this funding campaign I hope to raise 2300 towards the cost of my trips to Mexico and El Salvador. Your help and believe in me to achieve my ultimate goal to play soccer in a different country is what I am hoping to obtain from this campaign.

Working farmers markets doesn't leave me with much to get to my destination. 

My point is i'm pres-suing something and no one looks to happy about it? Because if your willing to go through all the battling you got to go through to get to where you want to get whose got the right to stop you? I mean maybe some of you guys got something you never finished something you really want to do something you never said to somebody something and your told no even after you paid your dues whose got the right to tell you that? who nobody! Its your right to listen to your gut it ain't nobody's right to say no after you earn the right to be where you want to be and do what you want to do. You know the older I get the more things I have to leave behind that's life the only thing I'm asking you guys to leave on the table is whats right.

-Rocky Balboa 


What We Need & What You Get

  • The total cost for my flights will be $2000 with my gear and luggage, transportation
  • My accommodation will cost $1500  
  • $500 for gear

The Impact

You know who I am now and what I am reaching for with this said, I want to thank God first and most for allowing me to play such a beautiful game. Your contribution won't go unnoticed because you will help me get to my final destinations and be a part of team Edwin. Being a part of my team makes the trip easier for me.

I can accept failure, but I can't accept not trying.
-Michael Jordan


    Risks & Challenges

    I will be flying to this destinations because driving is dangerous with all the cartels and gangs. 

    • I will fly and have someone that knows the place well drive me around.

    Other Ways You Can Help 


    • You can't donate no problem tell your friends to share my link
    • you can also contribute by spreading the word through Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn ...etc.
    • You have any other ideas ....massages, meal plan, different work outs for soccer feel free to contact me All.

story:
SUCCESS... We hit 118% of our goal!!! Now it's time to build the site, and start delivering perks and great content!  IF you missed our campaign and want to stay in touch... join my mailing list at ModelWarrenFitness.com

Hi, I’m Warren, but some of you probably know me through social media as ModelWarren, the wolf, the hairy guy that takes a bunch of pics and doesn't talk much. wellllllllllllll------ enough is enough. 

When I first started in fitness, I didn’t know what to do or where to go… and I made a lot of silly mistakes. Over the past five years I’ve used fitness programs paired with proper nutrition and motivation to transform my body not only one, but three times! I’d like the opportunity to help you reach your fitness goals by helping you discover the best version of yourself. 


And the Cover of my Ebook....




Why Indiegogo?

There’s a large population of people ready to start their fitness journey, but just don’t know where to start. I’ve wanted to create something for the people, by the people. By doing an Indiegogo campaign, we are able to spread the message and the vision to more people. I'm a regular person, just like you, and so I need to cover some of these expenses in order to move forward on the project. Your support of this campaign helps cover the initial expenses of the build out and allows me to create something that's extremely user friendly and provides all the tools and resources you'll need on your journey to creating your best version of you! Plus, I’ve got some pretty cool perks for you!


What is ModelWarrenFitness?

My goal with ModelWarren Fitness is to serve as a platform for people who are looking to get rid of stubborn belly fat, build lean muscle mass, and create better nutritional choices. ModelWarrenFitness.com will be a community where people can find the support and motivation they need not only from me, but through each other. We will accomplish this through offering:

- Monthly Membership Site (workout routines, recipes, online cooking show, and more!)

- Customized (personal) Meal Plans

- Customized (personal) Workout Routines

- A series of e-books of various health/fitness related topics

- Group Coaching

- One on One Coaching

- Meal Prep tips


So Where Does Your Contribution Go?

Starting a venture like this requires quite a bit of startup capital, so I’m hoping you can help me out so I can help you and others! The funds raised here will help me cover some of the startup costs, which include:

- ModelWarrenFitness.com Buildout and Design

- Proofreading

- Editing

- Art & Design

- Layout/Format

- Professional fees

I’ve got quite a few perks for this campaign, and they start at just $1!! While I’ll be able to do a lot more one on one coaching in the future, right now my focus is building this online platform and community to serve more people. As such, certain perks are limited.


Speaking of Perks....

There are several limited edition or limited quantity perks! Everything from Ebooks to customized meal plans, shirts, access to the site, lifetime access to the site, personal coaching from me... and Monsters! Yes, Monsters. For those of you that know me from social media, you know I love to doodle and I'm always drawing things. If you want a monster, I'll draw one for ya! Here's what it could look like... but no two drawings are the same!


    Risks & Challenges

    I've contracted a team of professionals to help with the buildout of the site, branding, and ease of use for all new site members! The biggest risks are not raising all the funds needed for the site and/or the build of the site taking longer than estimated. It is my goal to officially launch the site in August 2014, but that could be delayed if we do not get fully funded or if there's a technological issue beyond my control.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't help by donating-- please pass this link on and share on social media. All my social links are on the bottom of this page.

      I look forward to helping you be the best version of you that you can be!!

story:
Diagnosed with stage 4 cancer. Underwent 22 radiation and 10 chemo treatments. Denied mortgage insurance due to loopholes in insurance. Accumulated large amount of debt keeping up with mortgage payments plus medical bills. Had sub clavical by pass due to radiatiom. Got shingles and hospitalized to remove gall bladder. Loss of Saliva glands due to radiation. Surgery for removal of teeth. Had hyposubtronic therapy to harden jaw bone. Umderwent 2 moe surgeries to implant stints on both sides of his neck. Then had 2 more surgeries for biopsies for return of cancer. Had 3 minor heart attacks.Underwent open heart surgery to replace 2 valves damaged by radiation. No help from any level of government.

What We Need & What we want

the money would go towards debt due to the bank and insurance co.

Whatever is accumulated above the goal will go to Critically injured Canadians who nneed help and relief from bills piling up while they are attempting to get better.

The Impact

Insurance companies and big banks should not be allowed to take advantage of those who become critically ill. Plus the government should pass a bill that would not allow underwriting insurance.

Risks & Challenges

Chance of cancer returning is high. Many major organs damaged. want to have some sort of life, plus be able to give  poor wife a rest, and return her home to her hometown of Thunder Bay.Disabled, unable to work.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donating $20.00 a month for 2 months by 1000 people will help achieve goal.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi,

My name is Daubin Rueschenberg.  Let me start by saying thank you to Andrew DiTomasso for nominating me for the ALS Ice Bucket Challenge! I will be donating $10 to alsa.org AND doing the Ice Bucket Challenge to show my support for finding a cure for ALS! If you do not know what ALS is, please click this link to find out more about this degenerative disease (Click here to learn about ALS).

Now, you may be wondering just how this is different than the normal ALS Ice Bucket Challenge. In addition to my donation to ALS research, I will also be asking for donations for my good friend and family member, Lisa Soltesz, who is currently suffering from a very similar disease known as MS (Multiple sclerosis).

You can find more information about MS by clicking this link (Click here to learn about MS). Lisa is an amazing person who lives in pain every single day. She has thousands of dollars worth of hospital bills and doctors expenses accumulated from her illness. Due to the nature of the disease, she can barely walk, thereby limiting her from finding extra sources of income to pay for her medical expenses. The disease is also taking a toll on her vision and overall quality of life. I have never seen such a happy, selfless person suffer so much.     :(

This is where I need YOUR help!

  • For every $10 dollars I raise (up to $100), I will do 1 ice bucket challenge for Lisa (10 buckets)!
  • If I reach at least $100, I will jump into a pool of ice!
  • If I go beyond $100, I will ask for user submissions for what they would like to see me do.

This is your chance to not just donate to an organization, but donate directly to a wonderful person who is suffering greatly from a debilitating disease. Any donation will be greatly appreciated whether it be $1 or $1000. I will post on Facebook the donation total given to Lisa at the end of this campaign and my video of the challenge. Thank you in advance for taking the time to read this. If you have any questions, feel free to email me at daubin1515@yahoo.com or look me up on Facebook.

    **I understand we are in a drought, so all the water used in my challenge will be recycled from a pool, less the ice.

    Thank you for your generosity!!

    Daubin Rueschenberg

story:
60 Mile Static Bike Challenge

The team at The Edward Wylie, Wetherspoons, are attempting to cycle 60 miles during a shift to raise as much money as possible for CLIC Sargent. 

We hope, with your help, to raise £500 to enable CLIC Sargent to continue providing vital clinical, practical and emotional support for young cancer patients. With the money raised, you are helping to fund the relocation of the two Scottish Home from Homes.

So please donate what you can and feel free to join us in the pub on Saturday 27th June to cheer us on!

Thank you,

From everybody at The Wylie


Why 60 miles?

When a child or young person is diagnosed with cancer, families may face an average round trip of 60 miles to receive treatment, several times a week. As the hospitals that treat children and young people with cancer in Glasgow and Edinburgh are moving, CLIC Sargent urgently needs to raise around £3m so we can move our Homes from Home too, and continue to provide free accommodation to young cancer patients and their families close by.

Pubs around Scotland are challenged to cycle 60 miles in one day, raising £5 per mile to help fund the new Homes from Home. 


Here's a little about what CLIC Sargent do:

Each year around 300 children and young people are diagnosed with cancer in Scotland. During treatment, which can last up to three years, normal, everyday life is turned upside down.

CLIC Sargent Homes from Home are vital for families who regularly travel large distances for their child to be treated for cancer. They provide free self-catering accommodation, just a short walk from the hospital, so that the family (parents or carers and siblings) can stay together at this difficult time. Our Homes from Home in Scotland are Cruachan House in Glasgow and CLIC Villa in Edinburgh.

Please donate today, so that families dealing with cancer can stay together.

story:
Craig's story:

Craig was born with a hereditary kidney disease called Alport Syndrome.   He lost his hearing as a child but didn't know how sick he was until he was playing college basketball and after being diagnosed with high blood pressure, the syndrome was discovered.  A kidney transplant was his only chance at a life and on January 8, 1987, his dad gave him a kidney.  Thanks to this this amazing kidney, Craig had 25 years of great kidney function.  In the last 13 years, he's had issues with heart atrial fibrillation, endured 8 cardio versions, heart ablation, cataracts, blood clots and severe gout.  In 2011, Craig received the shocking news that his kidney function was deteriorating and by late 2013 was in need of another kidney transplant. His brother in law was a match and they had a successful transplant surgery in mid November, 2013, however, within days of being discharged home, he was in critical condition with a bleed at the transplant site.  Craig was immediately airlifted to his original transplant hospital and began the fight for his life.   Craig, Ellen and the boys endured 100 days through the holidays and well into 2014 as Craig fought for his life while being 2 hours away from his family.  Ellen and the boys never gave up the fight and stayed strong for Craig.  Craig was finally discharged and is now home with his family but he has a long road ahead of him and as you can imagine, they have incurred a lot of financial hardships.  God is great and we are so thankful that Craig is home.  

What can you do to help?

I've known Craig, Ellen and the boys since 2001 when our oldest boys were in preschool together.  We have kept in touch over the last 13 years even when moves took us thousands of miles away from each other.  We love them like family and would do anything in the world for them.  We hate that we are so far away and this is just one small way to make an impact in their lives.  Please help by making  a donation --every dollar helps.  They are such wonderful people and have been through so much.  This is a wonderful way for friends and family to help them in some small but powerful way.  The campaign will last 60 days and we ask that you share their story with everyone you know.

Thank you so much for your help, prayers and love for Craig, Ellen, Grant and Bryce!
story_txt: Craig's story:Craig was born with a hereditary kidney disease called Alport Syndrome.   He lost his hearing as a child but didn't know how sick he was until he was playing college basketball and after being diagnosed with high blood pressure, the syndrome was discovered.  A kidney transplant was his only chance at a life and on January 8, 1987, his dad gave him a kidney.  Thanks to this this amazing kidney, Craig had 25 years of great kidney function.  In the last 13 years, he's had issues with heart atrial fibrillation, endured 8 cardio versions, heart ablation, cataracts, blood clots and severe gout.  In 2011, Craig received the shocking news that his kidney function was deteriorating and by late 2013 was in need of another kidney transplant. His brother in law was a match and they had a successful transplant surgery in mid November, 2013, however, within days of being discharged home, he was in critical condition with a bleed at the transplant site.  Craig was immediately airlifted to his original transplant hospital and began the fight for his life.   Craig, Ellen and the boys endured 100 days through the holidays and well into 2014 as Craig fought for his life while being 2 hours away from his family.  Ellen and the boys never gave up the fight and stayed strong for Craig.  Craig was finally discharged and is now home with his family but he has a long road ahead of him and as you can imagine, they have incurred a lot of financial hardships.  God is great and we are so thankful that Craig is home.  What can you do to help?I've known Craig, Ellen and the boys since 2001 when our oldest boys were in preschool together.  We have kept in touch over the last 13 years even when moves took us thousands of miles away from each other.  We love them like family and would do anything in the world for them.  We hate that we are so far away and this is just one small way to make an impact in their lives.  Please help by making  a donation --every dollar helps.  They are such wonderful people and have been through so much.  This is a wonderful way for friends and family to help them in some small but powerful way.  The campaign will last 60 days and we ask that you share their story with everyone you know.Thank you so much for your help, prayers and love for Craig, Ellen, Grant and Bryce!

story:
What is Heroes on the Water?

Heroes on the Water serves our nation’s warriors and veterans from all branches of the military by providing healing and rehabilitating kayak fishing outings that are physically and mentally therapeutic through our nationwide community of volunteers and donors. With your donation we can offer a life-altering experience for wounded warriors.

Warriors have seen a 78% reduction in overall stress, 77% reduction in hyper vigilance and 63% reduction in avoidance behavior through our program backed by donors like you.

Founded in 2007, our unique kayak fishing program allows the participants a chance to decompress from the stresses associated with combat and the physical rigors of rehabilitation. We want to continue serving these heroes across the entire nation!

    Here's what we need:

    Our nation’s warriors face a new battle as they return home. You can give them and their families peace and hope for a brighter future by making a donation today. Your gift provides the HOW kayak fishing program to warriors at no charge to them or their families.

    This is what we can provide warriors with your donation:

    $25 – Lures, bait and fishing supplies

    $50 – Gives a Warrior ½ day of kayak fishing

    $100 – Gives a Warrior a day of kayak fishing

    $1000 – Buys one outfitted kayak, or 10 “Vet Days” on the water

    Every donation gives warriors healing and hope.

    What's in it for donors?

    You make this program available to warriors across the country by giving generously and we would like to thank you for your donation.

    Any $10 or more donation will receive access to our exclusive newsletter, Ripple Effect. For just a few more dollars, the first 100 donors at the $25 level will receive a Heroes on the Water sticker.  Double that donation and provide ½ day of kayak fishing for a warrior by giving $50. The first 50 $50 donors receive a Heroes on the Water sticker AND hat. Donate an additional $25 and for a total donation of $75, the first 50 donors will receive a Heroes on the Water sticker, hat AND t-shirt.

    HOW Sticker

    HOW Hat

    HOW Shirt Back

    HOW Shirt Front

    *We do not anticipate not reaching the goal because we have faith in our donors and we know you have faith in Heroes on the Water. However, if for some reason we do not reach our entire goal on Indiegogo, we are going to keep the funds we raised and sustain our fundraising efforts so that we can continue to serve military heroes.

    Will this make an impact?

    What looks like a day trip of paddling and fishing is in fact something much deeper and long-lasting.

    Warriors and veterans receive basic kayak fishing and paddling instruction, angling clinics and paddling classes for participants with skill sets ranging from beginners to the most experienced paddlers.

    The program also assists these personnel in adapting these newly developed skills to their new abilities. Adaptive kayaks, kayaking accessories and angling equipment is offered on an as needed basis to accommodate a soldier’s particular needs.

    Our program is unique in that it is a long-term activity, not a one-time event. We believe that the effectiveness of the program is a direct result of engaging the wounded military personnel for the long-term.

    One soldier, at the Center for the Intrepid, called what we do “Triple Therapy” or “all at once therapy.” On post he has to go to the gym for physical therapy, then go upstairs for his occupational therapy, and then go to the psychologist for mental therapy. With kayak fishing he gets it all at once - physical therapy from paddling and fishing, occupational therapy learning a lifetime sport/activity, and mental therapy from relaxing in nature with no distractions or expectations of performance.

    How else can I help?

    We understand that not everyone has the funds to contribute, but we believe everyone has a voice!  Here are some ways you can help without donating funds:

    • Spread our story by telling your friends, family, coworkers, neighbors, basically anyone you come in contact with! This will build buzz about our campaign and give us more opportunity to reach our goal!

    • Use the Indiegogo share tools!  This is a phenomenal way to reach your social network and boost our campaign within the Indiegogo community!

story:
Funds required to help Mynor

$5000 is needed to cover the cost of all evaluations, both lower extremity prostheses, a wheelchair designed specifically for someone who is one handed and home modifications.

Donations are submitted through a U.S. based non-profit 501(c)(3) and are tax deductible. 


About Mynor

When Mynor was 9 years old, while flying a kite with friends in the streets of San Antonio Aguas Calientes, Guatemala, his kite became stuck in a tree. He climbed the tree to retrieve it and was shocked by high voltage electrical lines intertwined in the branches, which nearly killed him.  He was rushed for emergency treatment which resulted in the amputation of both of his legs below the knee, and his left arm.  After surviving this trauma, he was brought to the US by a non-profit organization to receive care from Shriners Hospital.  He received bilateral lower extremity prosthetics and returned to Guatemala to live with his family in their village.  After receiving his prosthetics, Mynor lived the typical life of a child in his village.  He played soccer with his peers and engaged in school tasks using his right hand. 

15 years have passed.  Mynor is now 24 and has not received any follow-up care.  His prosthetics don’t fit and cause bleeding and pain when used. As a result, he spends his days bedbound in a dark room without social interaction.  He does not have use of a wheelchair to even have minimal mobility within his room.  Outside of his room, the home is made up of dirt hills that require adaptation and a means of mobility for him to access or to engage in even simple tasks to assist his family, such as helping taking care of animals.  Mynor has no means of participating in community activities and expressed feelings of isolation and hopelessness.  Due to all the time that Mynor spent in bed, he also has experienced a significant decline in his overall strength and endurance. 

As a child, Mynor was eligible for initial care outside of Guatemala, but he is not eligible as an adult.  There is no public healthcare system in place in Guatemala to provide the resources he needs to regain mobility to lead a more meaningful and productive life.  With your assistance, we can make all the difference in the life of this young man.  Just having the ability to walk again would be transformative to his psyche and to his quality of life.  His community is close at hand that is ready to embrace him as soon as he is able to leave his room, which has become his prison.  He has a warm and supportive family who are ready and eager to have him participate fully in daily living activities so he can become a functioning, contributing adult member of his community. 

Please help us by contributing to this campaign at any level possible and by helping to spread the word by sharing this link through Facebook and other social media.  With your assistance, we can help Mynor make his goal of walking again a reality.  In the near distant future, Mynor can be on his feet again and ready to be a part of his community where he will be able to once again share all of his skills and abilities. 

THANK-YOU!!!


Additional Information

In January 2015, we had the pleasure of meeting Mynor while working in San Antonio Calientes, Guatemala, with Nueva Generación, a U.S. based non-profit 501(c)(3). They provide financial scholarships to children who could not otherwise attend school in the village.  We volunteered on a social outreach project and joined forces with Temple Beth Or in North Carolina and Congregation Kol Ami in Los Angeles to build a house for a local family and to conduct a camp for kids.

An OT with our group was asked to complete a home assessment to see if there was anything that could be done to assist a bedridden young man.  In researching possible ways to help him, group members came across another non-profit organization in Antigua called Transitions Foundation of Guatemala. Their mission is “to mobilize Guatemalans with disabilities through health, rehabilitation, education, spiritual development, leadership skills, social integration and employment.” With the defined funding provided by this campaign, Transitions can change this situation from one of being an unattainable dream to making a dream come true for Mynor and his family.

www.nuevagen.org

www.transitionsfoundation.org

story:
Fighting for Charity

I`m is raising money for a local fighter and i`m willing do to anything. So EbuGamer is getting in the ring for a fight!

  • My name is Mat,from EbuGamer on Facebook.
  • https://www.facebook.com/EbuGamer1
  • My campaign is to raise money for my training instructors and a fighter who is going to Thailand to train.
  • I start my 10 week training at the start of August and i fight in October in a Wannabe Thai Boxing comeptition.

This time i`m putting my body on the line for you guys. As you know i`m not a fighter yet and  have only started training in Thai Boxing. Over the next six months i will be training everyday so when the time comes i will have some experience.

What I Need & What You Get

  • I`m trying to raise $2000+.
  • There will be some perks, all depends on how much you donate.
  • The funds will go and be recorded and uploaded on YouTube for you all to see where the money goes.
  • EbuGamer is a registered Australian Business.

Risks & Challenges

  •  I am open to everything when it comes to helping others. This time i will be getting in the ring and putting my body on the line.
  • This will be one of my biggest challenges to date

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I don`t want anyone to feel obligated to help so if you can`t afford it all a can ask for is for you to share this.
  • And that's all there is to it.

story:
***** Please note, that while this campaign has officially ended, raising continued funds for these kids and this program moving forward, is an on-going effort. YOU CAN STILL GIVE, in fact generous folks who have seen our cause just a little "late" have still be contributing and because of them, we actually hit over $2,000! 

It's not over, go ahead and read the story below, and give.  A genuine set of thank yous. ******


On June 14th, 14 kids from the Bronx Academy of Letters are going to do something most kids, forget kids, most people never think of doing in their lives: the Swim Seventy Seaside Triathlon - an endurance event consisting of a 1/2 mile swim, 10 mile bike ride and 3.1 mile run - all in one shot. The TriLatino Junior Team is a training and life-skills development program* run out of the Bronx Academy of Letters public high school in the South Bronx. Many of these kids have never swam or ridden a bike before their 14-week training program.  What they have in abundance in physical and mental tenacity for this race, they lack in gear.  We can not let these kids fall short of the finish line. We can get them there, but we need your support.

Our goal is to raise $1,200 by June 1st, in order to purchase the required gear, so these athletes have adequate time to train before the race starts.

Muevete! Get the word out! Share with your groups, friends and family! Get on facebook, twitter... you know, do what you do, but now for a good cause.

Like the race, the deadline is fast approaching.  All and any support is appreciated and ALL donations are tax deductible. Any funds raised above and beyond our original goal will fund this unique program for the youth at Bronx Academy of Letters in 2016. 


**** Additional Information on this program ****

* Every year, TriLatino Triathlon Club, with support from the Simon Bolivar Foundation, sponsors a group of inner city youth to explore the sport of triathlon as a fun and active way to combat the high incidence of diabetes, obesity and high cholesterol health issues that affect low-income communities.  Through this after school program, teens learn important life skills such as gaining the discipline to work as a team in an effort to complete a goal, practice proper nutrition, lead an active lifestyle through weekly training sessions, balance their academic workload, and most importantly, recognize the positive long term impact of healthy living in their lives; skills that will help them well beyond crossing the finish line.

Truly, thank you for your support of this fantastic program.

Find us at www.trilatino.org or click the links below.

story:
We've successfully funded on kickstarter and are now taking pre-orders on Indiegogo In Demand.

UPDATE: Pre-orders are available for Sealblades Rush - smaller sizes for teens and smaller adults. 

You can buy Sealblades in large sizes now for immediate delivery on our website www.sealblades.com/shop 

What are Sealblades?

Sealblades are retractable hand paddles that fit to each forearm with a neoprene sleeve and velcro strapping, are held in the deployed position by the hand, give you up to 35% more paddling power and then instantly retract out of the way once you release the grip to return to the resting position on your arm. Having your hands free allows you to do all the things you'd normally do.  Our testers tell us they make them feel like a bit of a super hero.

Who are Sealblades for? 

Sealblades are for active, sporty, water loving types, for people who want to get a taste of the experience of surfing without putting their bodies on the line, for people who may never have surfed before but want to get out on a board to explore, have a paddle, a work out or maybe get back up-wind after a lovely Stand Up Paddle board session. For active families looking for extra entertainment for a day at the beach.   Think of them  as an alternative to Stand Up Paddle boarding and a fun piece of kit to add to your portfolio of toys.

Exclusive version for pre-order - Sealblades Rush   

We’re calling them our Zero range as they are the first ever batch that will be produced. They’ll have a special ‘Zero’ mark on them so you’ll know you were one of the very first people on the planet to own Sealblades.  

Sealblades Zero Rush - a smaller, streamlined Sealblades design for smaller adults and teens. Smaller blade surface, slightly less power and resistance for the less buff among us but no less fun. 

 

 

Sizes on the sleeve and strapping are adjustable. 

Colours 

Sealblades Rush will be available in a choice of colours and colour combinations. We'll update you on the colours during the campaign and will send you a survey soon to ask you to choose the colour combinations that you'd like for your Sealblades. 

Patents applied for (PCT/GB2015/050152 & UK Patent 1614320.8) 

Sealblades Beanie 

And with every pair of Sealblades we send out we'll also send you our cosy Sealblades Beanie. We're good that way. 

 

Sealblades in the media 

Development  

We’ve been developing Sealblades for over two years now and testing at each stage of the prototype development has been key to getting the product to a launch-ready position. And now for the ultimate test! We are looking to build a community of people around us who use the Sealblades and give us feedback to help us continue to improve and refine them to make them even better. We’d love to have you involved.  

What will you do with 35% more paddle power?  

Sealblades can be used to boost prone paddle boarding, for surfing or for people who just want to get out on a board to explore or have a good workout. What will you do? Kayak-fishing perhaps? Or just get back up wind easily after a great SUP session? There is so much you can do with Sealblades.  

Fun index  

May not stand up to deep statistical scrutiny but we did some research with prototype testers and 80% gave a 7/10 or higher result for fun. We like fun so that was important to us.

Rewards 

Pledge £10 

We'll add your name to our surf board of gratitude which we'll hang in our office as a constant reminder of all the wonderful people who have supported us. We'll think of it as your personal high five to us. We are so grateful.

Sealblades Zero Rush - Pledge £32

Pledge £35 and join our community and be the owner of the very first batch of Sealblades Zero Rush exclusively available on Kickstarter. Choose your colour (we’ll send you a survey after the campaign completes) and we’ll get ready to package up your shiny new kit. We'll also add your name to our gratitude surf board and send you a cosy Sealblades beanie.

Two pairs of Sealblades Zero Rush - Pledge £59

Want to avoid the wonderful people in your life fighting over Sealblades Zero Rush? Here's the deal for you. Not one but two pairs of lovely Sealblades Zero Rush. Choose your colour (we’ll send you a survey after the campaign completes) and we’ll get ready to package up your shiny new kit. We'll also add your name to our gratitude surf board and send you two cosy Sealblades beanies.

Family Bundle - Pledge £150

Family Sealblades races anyone?  Choose your colours (we’ll send you a survey after the campaign completes) and we’ll get ready to package up your family bundle. We'll also add your name to our gratitude surf board and send you four cosy Sealblades beanies.

We'll send you a survey after the campaign so you can choose your colours. 

Timelines 

We are managing our timelines closely and are making every effort to ensure we hit our deadlines. We will keep communicating with our lovey backers throughout the time period. The manufacturing tools are being built now (Jan 2016). 

Very impressed that you have read this far - high five from us! 

We'll firm up on colour choices and get in touch with you to make your selections.  

So, go on ahead and back us with a little or large pledge. We'd love to have you as part of our community.

Alex and Sorcha O'Connor Co-Founders
story_txt: We've successfully funded on kickstarter and are now taking pre-orders on Indiegogo In Demand.UPDATE: Pre-orders are available for Sealblades Rush - smaller sizes for teens and smaller adults. You can buy Sealblades in large sizes now for immediate delivery on our website www.sealblades.com/shop What are Sealblades?Sealblades are retractable hand paddles that fit to each forearm with a neoprene sleeve and velcro strapping, are held in the deployed position by the hand, give you up to 35% more paddling power and then instantly retract out of the way once you release the grip to return to the resting position on your arm. Having your hands free allows you to do all the things you'd normally do.  Our testers tell us they make them feel like a bit of a super hero.Who are Sealblades for? Sealblades are for active, sporty, water loving types, for people who want to get a taste of the experience of surfing without putting their bodies on the line, for people who may never have surfed before but want to get out on a board to explore, have a paddle, a work out or maybe get back up-wind after a lovely Stand Up Paddle board session. For active families looking for extra entertainment for a day at the beach.   Think of them  as an alternative to Stand Up Paddle boarding and a fun piece of kit to add to your portfolio of toys.Exclusive version for pre-order - Sealblades Rush   We’re calling them our Zero range as they are the first ever batch that will be produced. They’ll have a special ‘Zero’ mark on them so you’ll know you were one of the very first people on the planet to own Sealblades.  Sealblades Zero Rush - a smaller, streamlined Sealblades design for smaller adults and teens. Smaller blade surface, slightly less power and resistance for the less buff among us but no less fun.   Sizes on the sleeve and strapping are adjustable. Colours Sealblades Rush will be available in a choice of colours and colour combinations. We'll update you on the colours during the campaign and will send you a survey soon to ask you to choose the colour combinations that you'd like for your Sealblades. Patents applied for (PCT/GB2015/050152 & UK Patent 1614320.8) Sealblades Beanie And with every pair of Sealblades we send out we'll also send you our cosy Sealblades Beanie. We're good that way.  Sealblades in the media Development  We’ve been developing Sealblades for over two years now and testing at each stage of the prototype development has been key to getting the product to a launch-ready position. And now for the ultimate test! We are looking to build a community of people around us who use the Sealblades and give us feedback to help us continue to improve and refine them to make them even better. We’d love to have you involved.  What will you do with 35% more paddle power?  Sealblades can be used to boost prone paddle boarding, for surfing or for people who just want to get out on a board to explore or have a good workout. What will you do? Kayak-fishing perhaps? Or just get back up wind easily after a great SUP session? There is so much you can do with Sealblades.  Fun index  May not stand up to deep statistical scrutiny but we did some research with prototype testers and 80% gave a 7/10 or higher result for fun. We like fun so that was important to us.Rewards Pledge £10 We'll add your name to our surf board of gratitude which we'll hang in our office as a constant reminder of all the wonderful people who have supported us. We'll think of it as your personal high five to us. We are so grateful.Sealblades Zero Rush - Pledge £32Pledge £35 and join our community and be the owner of the very first batch of Sealblades Zero Rush exclusively available on Kickstarter. Choose your colour (we’ll send you a survey after the campaign completes) and we’ll get ready to package up your shiny new kit. We'll also add your name to our gratitude surf board and send you a cosy Sealblades beanie.Two pairs of Sealblades Zero Rush - Pledge £59Want to avoid the wonderful people in your life fighting over Sealblades Zero Rush? Here's the deal for you. Not one but two pairs of lovely Sealblades Zero Rush. Choose your colour (we’ll send you a survey after the campaign completes) and we’ll get ready to package up your shiny new kit. We'll also add your name to our gratitude surf board and send you two cosy Sealblades beanies.Family Bundle - Pledge £150Family Sealblades races anyone?  Choose your colours (we’ll send you a survey after the campaign completes) and we’ll get ready to package up your family bundle. We'll also add your name to our gratitude surf board and send you four cosy Sealblades beanies.We'll send you a survey after the campaign so you can choose your colours. Timelines We are managing our timelines closely and are making every effort to ensure we hit our deadlines. story:
BALLROOM BASIX BACKGROUND

Headquartered in Harlem, the birthplace of swing and home to merengue & salsa in "El Barrio" (Spanish Harlem), BALLROOM BASIX™ (BBX) has been heralded by educators, administrators and parents as a priceless contribution to the social & emotional development of young teens as they begin to navigate the many challenges of adolescence. Founded in 2008 by championship dancer Sidney B. Grant, BALLROOM BASIX™ (named for the SIX steps of the box step as well as the SIXth grade!) was developed and refined over a two-year period in two Harlem middle schools, culminating in the creation of NYC's only NON-COMPETITIVE partner dancing program—including merengue, tango, swing, foxtrot, rhumba, waltz, salsa, cha cha, and a country-western favorite that we dance to the kids' pop music: the barn dance! And although learning the dances is a skill in and of itself, our purpose and impact are far greater than the dances themselves.

Let's face it: Bullying is EPIDEMIC among today's young people, especially in middle school. ANYTHING we can do/support to deter bullying by transforming peer relations among classmates is worth contributing to! And since there are no "teams" involved, that means ALL children—regardless of appearance, ability, attitude, or popularity—get the chance to connect rotationally and respectfully with other students their age.

These critical socialization skills are further enhanced by our final BALLROOM BASIX BASH at the conclusion of classes. By bringing together two schools that do not know one another without competition, we enable children to "MEET the other school, not BEAT the other school"—a much healthier culminating event than competition. The "gentlemen" from each school go over to the "ladies" from the other school and ask them for the dance, escorting them onto the dance circle to present the Ballroom & Latin dances they've learned, to the amazement and appreciation of parents & friends. Meeting a stranger is difficult at any age...and BALLROOM BASIX provides this life lesson in the context of a creative arts activity that improves self-confidence, poise and politeness.

Furthermore, considering how terribly device-addicted the kids are nowadays, getting them hand-in-hand, arm-in-arm and eye-to-eye is a real game changer in terms of how they relate to one another. And with all the alarming incidents of inappropriate behavior in schools among teens, what better way to instill a sense of physical respect among classmates as they dance from one student to the next?!? 

MORE Teaching Artists. MORE schools. MORE students!

As more and more schools recognize the merits of our mission, the demand for our innovative arts-in-education initiative increases exponentially. That means the need for more teaching assistants who will be trained and groomed in order to become bonafide BBX Teaching Artists. 

It also means coordinating with all the new schools contacting us that want to bring our "fun, fitness & fancy footwork" to their students. Many of these schools, however, cannot afford even our modest tuition, so YOUR DONATION can directly support a school that cannot otherwise afford our BALLROOM BASIX™ programming. It also supports our ability to coordinate ongoing relationships with these school and their principals, vice principals and parent coordinators, so that BBX can become an integral part of their middle school culture.

The LIFE-CHANGING impact of BALLROOM BASIX

These turbulent times have revealed just how sadly disconnected we are as a society. Connecting schoolchildren—rotationally and respectfully—with their classmate, can help heal the divisions they experience, personally and culturally, in their communities, many of whom are in under-served, inner-city environments. But don't take our word for it...read what one of our "ladies" from the Bronx wrote IN HER OWN WORDS:

Challenges of our not-for-profit, arts-in-education initiative

We all know arts funding has significantly diminished in recent years. Running a non-profit like ours requires the time and talent of dedicated professionals, both artistic and administrative, to sustain the quality and integrity of our meaningful mission. Behind the scenes, there is extensive program coordination required: communications, contracts, insurance, development—just to name a few of our routine responsibilities.

On the "foxtort" front lines (and in the "tango" trenches), our Teaching Artists and their assistants require expert training and supervision to maintain the calibre of our creative curriculum. We consistently reinforce both syllabus content and methodology/classroom management strategies to ensure the polish, punctuality and preparedness of Team BBX!

DONATE your "DANCING DOLLARS" TODAY! 

ANY AMOUNT you can contribute to our campaign is hugely appreciated. And passing along our fundraising efforts to your friends, families and colleagues means that many more under-served schoolchildren benefitting from this unique, non-competitive partner dancing experience!

  • Please get the word out via email and social media!
  • "Like" our Facebook page and Instagram pictures...and post supporting comments!
  • Use our Indiegogo share tool LINK so more people can donate to our year-end campaign!
  • Search YouTube for all our engaging BALLROOM BASIX™ testimonial video and "like" them!
  • Remember our motto: "Making manners matter...every move we make!"

NOTE: All donations of $250 or more are formally acknowledged by the New York Foundation for the Arts (NYFA), our fiscal sponsor, as per IRS guidelines. Thank you for your gift of ANY amount!

story:
The Journey

Hello! My name is Yesika Bravo. I am an Intuitive Healer, Licensed Acupuncturist, and Reiki Master Teacher, with a background in Sports Medicine. My purpose, my mission, and my passion in this life is to help people, like you, unlock and uncover their healing potential that lies deep within each one of us. 

Like many other Holistic Health practitioners, I was forced to temporarily close my office due to COVID-19. During this time I was inspired to share very simple and effective ways for people to take control of their health and wellness at home. For years I have always given my patients “homework” or techniques to work with at home between appointments to support the work we were doing during their treatments. However, there was never a simple to use self-care guide available for patients to reference, unless I made custom packets of information for each. 

That’s when the inspiration hit! I needed to create a simple and accessible guide that virtually anyone could use in order to become self-reliant in their own healing journey! Thus, Wellness Within was born!

Based on the Eight Branches of Classical Chinese Medicine, Wellness Within is laid out in a simple and accessible way to allow you to work holistically on yourself, not just address one topic but address all areas of your life and really make lasting change. 

The Eight Branches of Classical Chinese Medicine:

  1. Meditation
  2. Movement
  3. Cosmology
  4. Nutrition
  5. Feng Shui 
  6. Bodywork 
  7. Herbology
  8. Acupuncture/Acupressure

Wellness Within is intended to be an entire series made up of various decks that will span across multiple concerns. The first deck to be released, and presented in this campaign, is the Anxiety & Stress Edition. This Anxiety & Stress Edition is meant to help anyone who may be suffering from anxiety or stress in their life, providing simple and effective ways to manage your symptoms from a Classical Chinese Medicine perspective. Not only is this deck full of holistic self-care and practices, but it has been charged with Reiki Healing Energy so that you can receive additional support on your journey from this added healing modality. 

Future decks to follow, include:

  • Gastro-Intestinal Concerns
  • Sleep Concerns
  • Headaches & Migraines
  • Pain Management
  • Weight Management
  • Skin Concerns 
  • and much more 

By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping me to finalize the first deck in this project and bring it to the world in its physical form. As a self-employed, Holistic Health practitioner, I have done the work to provide you with the best knowledge and experience that will support you on your wellness journey. Some things, however, are not part of my forte. Hiring graphic designers and artists who can help me bring this vision to reality is a wonderful part of the process. 

At this moment, the bulk of the content and work has been complete. I await for graphics and art to be completed, to then finalize this first deck and send it off to the magical world of card deck printing! 

UPDATE 9/5/2020: The deck is now complete and ready to begin the printing stage and shipping stage. I have received my own copy for review and all looks good!! Orders will soon begin to ship.

Please note: There is now an added perk of an Acupressure Tool for those who wich to add it. If you are purchasing a deck for the first time you can select it as an add-on perk before check out. If you have already purchased a deck and would like to add this to your current order, please selent the stand-alone Acupressure Tool perk listed alongside the other perks. No added shipping costs for this add-on when a deck has been purchased. 

 

What Is Needed 

I have set a goal of $2,000 in order to cover the cost of:

  • Graphic and Art design

And 

  • Printing and packaging fees

 

What You Get

You have the option to: 

  • Donate any amount to support this project and sign up to receive notifications and discounts codes for future decks scheduled to be released down the line.

Or 

  • Pre-order the first deck and sign up to receive notifications and discounts codes for future decks scheduled to be released down the line. 

 

Even if the goal is not met, the funds will still go towards the final production steps needed to complete the first deck in the project, and those who pre-ordered will still receive a final product.

I believe so strongly in this project that it will be brought to life!

 

Risks & Challenges

Some risks and challenges that may come up while finalizing the first deck in this project are having sizing or printing difficulties. I want to ensure that you receive the best quality product I can provide. I am learning and growing each day that I work on this, and I understand that printing can come with its own challenges in making sure that everything looks as it should. I am in communication with my graphic designers and artists to make sure that all images will meet the necessary guidelines for the printing company, as well as communicating with the printers to ensure we have taken every necessary step to have the best and smoothest outcome with the final product. This first deck will lay the groundwork for all future decks and make for a smoother process in producing the final products. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I thank you for reading this far and I appreciate any and all support you can give to this project. Whether or not you can contribute at this time, I ask for your help in getting the word out by sharing this campaign with as many people as possible. Use the share tools included on this page to share with your loved ones! 

Thank you, from the bottom of my heart! 

- Yesika 

 
Watch the LIVE Reveal!

 

Final Product Images

 

 

Sample Images

story:
At Laguna Fin Co. we created a swimming fin that leaves your feet as happy as you are once you leave the water. Growing up we spent most of our time at beaches and in pools around Laguna Beach. We were tired of uncomfortable fins that caused blisters and cramps. Even finding the right fin size was a major problem. So we designed a built-in neoprene foot pocket with adjustable straps, meant to fit your foot perfectly. Now we're happy to introduce the most comfortable fin on the planet! Say goodbye to uncomfortable fins and start swimming with Laguna Fin Co.

Olympian tested: Caroline Burckle 2008 USA Bronze Medalist 

 

  • Hand-sewn neoprene foot pocket for maximum comfort 
  • Reinforced toe pocket with water resistant military grade fabric (1000 Denier Cordura with urethane backing) 
  • Ultra responsive blade made from a polymer/rubber blend
  • Adjustable heel strap for perfect sizing
  • Hidden adjustable arch strap built to perfectly fit foot width
  • Extremely light-weight & travel friendly
  • Every pair comes with a mesh bag for quick dry
  • Net Weight of 1.4 lbs
  • Designed for competitive training
  • Uses: Swim stroke training, recreational, open water swimming, triathlon training, body surfing, bodyboarding, and snorkeling
  • All levels of swimmers
  • Small/Medium fits U.S. shoe sizes (Men's: 4 - 8.5+, Women's: 5 - 9+)
  • Large fits U.S. shoe sizes (Men's: 9.5 - 10.5+, Women's: 8.5 - 11+)
  • XL fits U.S. shoe sizes (Men's: 10.5 - 17+, Women's: 11.5+)

 

 

  • Hand-sewn neoprene foot pocket for maximum comfort 
  • Reinforced toe pocket with water resistant military grade fabric (1000 Denier Cordura with urethane backing) 
  • Ultra responsive blade made from a polymer/rubber blend
  • Adjustable heel strap for perfect sizing
  • Hidden adjustable arch strap built to perfectly fit foot width
  • Extremely light-weight & travel friendly
  • Every pair comes with a mesh bag for quick dry
  • Fits U.S. child shoe sizes (Y6-6)* (see diagram below)
  • Net Weight of < 1 lb.
  • Designed for children
  • Uses: Learning to swim, swim stroke training, recreational, beach activities, junior lifeguards, and snorkeling
  • All levels of swimmers

 

 

Never lose a pair of fins on the pool deck or at the beach again!

We will permanently add your name, nickname, or any lettering of your choice to the heel strap of your brand new Laguna Fins. It's easy, just choose a perk with personalized fins and we'll email you and ask you to let us know what you want added and we'll do the rest!

 

COMFORT 

Laguna Fins have a built-in neoprene foot pocket that maximizes comfort by molding perfectly to your feet, leaving them as happy as you are after a workout. Our neoprene foot pocket allows for 100% kicking power. There are over 7,000 nerve endings in each foot, keep them happy so you can kick with all your power. Laguna Fin Co. is guaranteed the most comfortable fin on the planet or your money back. Say goodbye to cuts, cramps, and blisters caused by stiff rubber fins, start swimming with Laguna Fin Co.

 

SIZING 

Laguna Fins are built with 2 adjustable straps meant to fit your foot perfectly. The adjustable heel strap fits perfectly to the length of each foot. This allows you to share fins easily, accommodate different sized feet and growth spurts. Just tighten to your liking and get swimming. The hidden arch strap adjusts to the width and arch of your foot, eliminating problems for narrow and wide feet. 

 

ALL 4 COMPETITIVE STROKES 

Now swimmers can train for all 4 competitive strokes; butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke, and freestyle! Most fins don't allow swimmers to turn their feet our properly to swim breaststroke. Laguna Fins were designed to allow breaststrokers and medley swimmers to train with fins. Don't believe us? Watch the video & hear it from the pros below!

"Game Changing Fin" with Olympian Kaitlin Sandeno from Laguna Fin Co on Vimeo.

"As a breaststroker, I wish I had access to these fins while I was still competing- finally a fin you can use to train all of the four strokes. Every swimmer needs a pair of Laguna Fins in their equipment bag!" 

- Kristy Kowal 2000 Olympic Silver Medalist (Breaststroke) 

“Laguna Fins is an amazing product I wish I had while I was training. They allow you to really feel the push and pull of the water, especially in breaststroke. Laguna Fins are a game changer for all swimmers but especially those that need to feel the water on the bottoms of their feet!”

– Cammile Adams 2012 & 2016 Olympian

 

TRAVEL 

Take Laguna Fins with you wherever you go! Our Competitive Fins have a combined weight of 1.4 lbs. The heel straps can be tucked inside the foot pocket and will take up minimum space inside your travel bag (10 x 6.5 x 2 inches). Our Youth Fins are even smaller, having a combined weight of <1 lb and can take up as little as 9 x 5.75 x 2 inches. Plus every pair of Laguna Fins comes in a small mesh bag which makes travel and hang-drying easier!

 

ANKLE FLEXIBILITY 

Laguna Fins are open heeled, and are not restricted by rubber, allowing your ankles to move freely and maximize your full range of motion. This also helps to strengthen your ankles and calf muscles, to their full potential.

 

OCEAN TO POOL

 

Used by triathletes, open water swimmers, and competitive pool swimmers around the world. Laguna Fin Co. is becoming everyone’s new favorite swimming fin from the pool to the ocean and back.

"Laguna Fin provides a fin that no other company can touch. I can have my athletes where these for longer pool sessions, as well as ocean sessions just the same. The lightweight design is not only the most comfortable fin on the market, Laguna Fins are the only fin that excels in both pool and open water, both freestyle and stroke. Load your team up with these fins!"

- Bryan Mineo @theswimmechanic

 

STRENGTHEN LEG & FOOT MUSCLES 

The Laguna Fin Co. blade is designed to make your legs work harder and build muscle strength in your legs & feet. Over-time this will create muscle memory, so when your fins come off your kick is stronger than ever. Laguna Fins are the recommended training fins used by 8x Olympic USA Swim Coach Mark Schubert.

 

IMPROVE BODY POSITIONING 

Laguna Fins float helping improve your horizontal body positioning. The natural buoyancy created by Laguna Fins keep your legs and feet towards the surface of the water. Plus you'll never lose another fin again!

 

REDUCE SHOULDER STRESS 

Your shoulders take on most of the stress from swimming. Let your legs reduce the stress you put on your shoulders by training with Laguna Fin Co. 

 

OLYMPIAN APPROVED 

Designed and tested by Olympians and Olympic coaches, Laguna Fin Co is proud to partner with these swim gurus. 2x Olympian and 4x Olympic medalist Kaitlin Sandeno is the official Laguna Fin Co. spokesperson and partner. “It is so exciting to introduce a fin to the aquatics world that is comfortable, adjustable, fitness orientated, great for the pool and ocean, and allows you to train all four strokes. I truly believe in our fin.” - Kaitlin Sandeno

 

We’ve developed the most comfortable fin on the planet for adults, now we’re focusing on providing the same for our youth. A swimming fin that kids can be happy about putting on, and one that they can continue to use as their feet grow rapidly. The Youth Fin has been designed with a working prototype and tested in the ocean and pool. We need your help to complete the molds and finalize our first production run. Your contributions will help pay for the Youth Fin mold, the first 1,000 pairs of Youth Fins in 3 different colors, and the continuous growth and evolution of Laguna Fin Co. Thank you for #swimminthedream with us!

 

 

Help us spread the word by clicking the links above. We are beyond grateful for all your support!

 

 

 

Laguna Fin Gift Bag $20 

Laguna Fin stickers, swim cap, pool bag, koozie (various colors), and hat (various colors).
