Includes:

-a detox spa treatment at your local organic or natural spa

-a full collection of CV Skinlabs products

-and the celebrity favorite "14-day Detox Cleanse" from renowned holistic and medical doctor, Frank Lipman, M.D. Find out why Kyra Sedgwick and Maggie Gyllenhaal rave about this cleanse! Read more details about Dr. Lipman's Cleanse here

 

 

  • Personalized Detox Packages with Natural Beauty Expert Britta Aragon


Choose from these packages below:


1. One-on-One Personal Detox Your World Session: (can be done from anywhere in the world)
Britta evaluates your current personal care & home care routine/products before your session.

  • 60-minute, one-on-one session via Skype—learn how to pick the right non-toxic skincare or makeup products for your skin type, discover how to read labels, and learn what ingredients to avoid for your optimal health.
  • Email support for 2 weeks, CV Skinlabs Sample Kit, and Britta's detox system for your personal care, cosmetics and cleaning products.


2. VIP Detox Your World Intenisve with Britta in NYC – Personal Detox Overhaul Intensive: (in NYC only, travel not included)

  • Includes all of the above.
  • Plus a private shopping tour of the right products for you (personal care, makeup, foods and cleaning products—products purchased on tour not included).
  • Also includes an organic lunch, CV Skinlabs full-size products, and a 14-day detox plan from Dr. Lipman.


3. The Detox Signature Lecture and Inspire Your Community Package from Britta—In Your City! (anywhere in the world)


This is an unprecedented opportunity to hear from natural beauty expert and author, Britta, in the new world of Safe Self Care.

  • Up to 50 participants. Travel and accommodations must be paid for by participant host.
  • Britta will tailor her speaking to your organization.
  • Ideal for spa and salon owners, non-profit organizations, community groups, book clubs, and volunteer care and caregiving personnel.
  • Let Britta inspire you to reduce your toxic load, choose safer products, manage cancer side effects, and detox your world.


Why Britta is Your Best Go-To Expert: Britta is a natural beauty expert and makeup artist who has worked in the beauty industry for more than 13 years. She is the founder of the Cinco Vidas Blog, author of When Cancer Hits, and creator of CV Skinlabs. Britta been featured in Organic Spa Magazine, People En Espanol, US Weekly, Telemundo 52, Real Simple Magazine, Crazy Sexy Life and more. She lectures around the country on personal detox and natural skin care. For more on Britta please click here

story_txt:
Because I know you’ve been there, too, where someone you cared about suffered from irritating, painful and devastating skin conditions.
You may have watched them struggle to find safe, effective and natural solutions that didn’t further irritate the skin or add potentially dangerous toxins to it.
My father went through this struggle when he suffered a debilitating rash during his cancer treatments, and a high-end cream supposedly for “sensitive skin” burned him even further.  I researched what was in the product and learned it was full of potentially harmful chemicals, some even linked to cancer. I was shocked! 
Studies have shown that standard ingredients in the global skincare market have been linked with irritation, dryness, and dullness, as well as more serious concerns like hormone disruption and even cancer. Yet most companies persist in using these questionable ingredients because they’re cheap and readily available. 

When will this stop? Enough is enough. We need to put an end to this, and we need your help.
To honor my father’s legacy, I created CV Skinlabs skincare. This line is 100% free of ingredients tied to cancer, hormone disruption and other health issues, and has been clinically proven  to help repair sensitive skins.   
My vision is to create a safe skincare revolution to deliver non-toxic, clean and effective skincare to those who need it most. This campaign is an effort to help me accomplish just that.  
With your support, we’ll be using every dollar raised in this campaign to accomplish two key objectives:



Deliver a sampling of all CV Skinlabs products to every hospital in the nation, so those who need them most will have access to them. 

Research additional solutions and product possibilities to help everyone with fragile and sensitive skin enjoy safe solutions that help repair and restore skin’s natural radiance and health.

story:
Sarah is a registered nurse who was diagnosed in December 2012 with ovarian cancer, that has spread to her colon. She is a single mom to 3 young children and will need to be off work for a significant amount of time for treatment.

My husband and I would like to collect money to help her and her children through this tough time ahead! She is very positive and is determined to win this fight. We are hoping to make it easier for her by having some funds set aside for her and her childrens needs.

 

February 28, 2013 Update: Sarah has been hospitalized for the past 2 weeks with complications from her chemo. This will delay her treatment by weeks or even months. This means she will not be going back to work by June, as previously planned. Her family needs our help more than ever. 

Please spread the word and let's work together to help Sarah and her family! If you have any questions feel free to e-mail either Chelsea (cmanzullo@gmail.com) or Bob (lvmedic3214@gmail.com).

story:
Let us introduce you to “Our Mom”, the most wonderful, beautiful, and strongest woman we know – Louise Velasquez. Louise has been happily married for 40 years to our awesome dad, John. Together they have 4 brilliant children (Crystal, Jessica, Paul, Valarie), 3 amazing in-laws (Jamie, Joe, Stephanie), and 3 glorious grandchildren (Isabella, Isaac, Michael).

We are asking for donations because our mom has been diagnosed with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease and the only way for our mom to get better is to have a liver and kidney transplant. Thankfully, she is currently on the list for these organs but the non stop ups and downs of frequent ER visits, overnight hospital stays, dialysis treatments 3x’s a week, weekly doctor appointments and the constant waiting for a phone call become overpowering.

All donations will be used for medical care and expenses. For example,

  • Dialysis 3x's week costs $20 per visit
  • Medications range from $10 - $250 (this does not include medications not covered by insurance)
  • ER costs $150/visit - Mom is admitted to the hospital at least 1 to 2 times a month
  • Weekly follow-up appointments with various providers range from $20 for primary care to $50 for specialist appointments
  • Annual deductible of $2500
  • 5% of what the transplant procedure would cost. For example, if the transplant costs $500,000; our portion would be $25,000.
As our mom gets stronger, we will be posting progress updates on how she is doing and provide pictures as she recovers. Having never been through something like this before, it is quite overwhelming how quickly a person can deteriorate when your organs don't work properly. We hope to provide inspiration to anyone who is going through similar situations.
 
Another goal would be to spread the word about the importance of becoming an organ donor. We never understood the impact of organ donation until we were faced with it ourselves. As we learn more, we wish to educate more about this important contribution to life.
 
If you can't contribute, please do not feel like you can't help. You can certainly help us by spreading the word for our cause. We could have never imagined or prepared for the financial impact that being a transplant patient would have. We truly want to spread the word and also encourage those who are not organ donors to consider it. Just imagine, you can potentially help someone who is as wonderful as our mom!
 
Thank you so much!

The Velasquez Family

story:
S.H.I.P-Our Mission

    Support for Humanitarianism through Intercontinental Projects, Inc. was founded by Matthew Berniard (a LSUHSC-S MSII at the time) and his wife Aimee (a LSUS graduate student at the time) in early February of 2009. They took on the task of starting and developing S.H.I.P. after realizing the need for international humanitarian projects at LSUHSC-S. Their goal was to bring all medical students and physicians who were  interested in learning compassionate care to a very rural and underserved area. After much research, Matt found an organization in rural western Kenya, who could provide the infrastructure for conducting mobile clinics, had been in operation for over a decade, and was in a safe area of the world. After receiving a strong interest from about a dozen second and third year students, they decided to move forward with the mission to travel to Kenya in February 2010.

   

Ship is a 501(c)3 organization accepting tax deductible donations. However, almost all of our operating funds are generated by medical student activities such as bake sales, garage sales and a yearly pre-med workshop for high school students interested in medicine. For the last 3 years this has supported the yearly trips for as many as 20 students serving approximately 1000 patients over the 3 weeks that they served in western Kenya.  Most of the diseases are neglected tropical diseases such as, malaria, Denge fever, typhoid and tuberculosis to name a few.  This year however, because of the price of travel our organization has fell short.  We are putting together some last minute fundraising but are asking for support so that this valuable service can continue.
story_txt:
S.H.I.P-Our Mission
    Support for Humanitarianism through Intercontinental Projects, Inc. was founded by Matthew Berniard (a LSUHSC-S MSII at the time) and his wife Aimee (a LSUS graduate student at the time) in early February of 2009. They took on the task of starting and developing S.H.I.P. after realizing the need for international humanitarian projects at LSUHSC-S. Their goal was to bring all medical students and physicians who were  interested in learning compassionate care to a very rural and underserved area. After much research, Matt found an organization in rural western Kenya, who could provide the infrastructure for conducting mobile clinics, had been in operation for over a decade, and was in a safe area of the world. After receiving a strong interest from about a dozen second and third year students, they decided to move forward with the mission to travel to Kenya in February 2010.
   
Ship is a 501(c)3 organization accepting tax deductible donations. However, almost all of our operating funds are generated by medical student activities such as bake sales, garage sales and a yearly pre-med workshop for high school students interested in medicine. For the last 3 years this has supported the yearly trips for as many as 20 students serving approximately 1000 patients over the 3 weeks that they served in western Kenya.  Most of the diseases are neglected tropical diseases such as, malaria, Denge fever, typhoid and tuberculosis to name a few.  This year however, because of the price of travel our organization has fell short.  We are putting together some last minute fundraising but are asking for support so that this valuable service can continue.

story:
Hi my name is Valerie Sorrells and our cousin Mike Grewe was diagnosed with cancer some months ago.  This week we received some bad news the cancer has spread to his Brain and they are giving him 4 to 6 weeks. He is going to be moved to Hospice in the next day or two. He has no other family and also has no insurance to help with final arrangements. So we are raising what little we can to help with funeral expenses. Every little bit helps thanks and God Bless.

I have some sad news to report, my cousin Mike went to be with the Lord on Friday March, 29th 2013.  We are now in need more than ever, trying to cover his final expenses. If you can donate just a little it woiuld be greatly appreicated.

story:
(THIS CAMPAIGN HAS NOW ENDED - TO DONATE OR SEE MORE INFORMATION PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE: www.uwr-wa.com)

We are Gifty Serbeh-Dunn and Michael Fountain. We met in the Cowichan Valley on Vancouver Island ten years ago, and our families have been friends ever since. Both of us are passionate about socially conscious business practices. This project is a perfect utilization of both of our talents and expertise, and is a cause we both feel very passionate about and committed to - reducing infant and maternal mortality.

Gifty: When Michael mentioned the portable ultrasound technology to me, I jumped at the idea, as I knew well that it would make a difference in the lives of expectant mothers and babies in Ghana. I was born and raised in Wa, in Upper West Region of Ghana, where the maternal and child mortality rate is extremely high. Any tools that would assist the hard working doctors there would be embraced. I set to work to connect the dots to make this project a possibility. Donations would enable us to purchase this amazing technology to bring to the health units in Wa, Upper West Region. Any effort to reduce maternal child mortality in this region means saving numerous lives, that of both mothers and babies. We are looking to raise 50,000 to take five ultrasound units and probes to the rural areas in UWR - Wa in Ghana.

Michael: I am a long time technologist with a great interest in people. At one time my focus was building the Internet, and later it became the safety and security of transactions and information online. I am interested in leveraging technology to improve the lives of people. We need help from others who have a similar vision to make this project a success.

The challenge was to uncover a technical advance that is available, provides a needed service, and can be quickly delivered to the point of use. Portable ultrasound is that technology. It is clear that the use of new, miniaturized ultrasound imaging drives early prenatal care to people who have not had access to pregnancy management early in the gestational period. Simply determining gestational age, and potential high risk conditions, is a huge win where resources are limited, and transportation must be planned weeks in advance. We are fortunate in Wa to be partnering with trusted regional providers who have identified their logistical and infrastructural needs and are the primary providers of care in the region.

Gifty: The closest comprehensive care facility is Tamale, a city which would be a four hour drive for most women living in rural areas of the region, but because of very bad roads it is a day’s journey away. Because of this, prenatal care using any such technology is out of reach for most women in this region. As my work involves assisting women in my home region, it makes sense to include maternal health issues as a necessary part of how I help their efforts at alleviating poverty. My family ties, as well as my professional connections in Wa, make me an excellent bridge between the community of Wa and you, the donor.

Michael: Delivery of services to the point of care is critical to the success of any health care initiative in remote regions such as the UWR in Ghana. Currently the barriers to the provision of technically advanced services in pre and perinatal medicine are the availability of the imaging equipment, transportation of providers to the point of care, training of the medical technologists, and the availability of expert interpretation.

This project will provide public health professionals with the tools for comprehensive prenatal care: lightweight mobile transportation, a medical kit that includes portable ultrasound for the health practitioner delivering the service, and training in the use of the ultrasound probe at the Midwifery Training College for the Upper West Region at St. Joseph's Hospital in Jirapa. Using telemedicine, ultrasound images can then be interpreted by physicians at major healthcare centres. Portable ultrasound provides detection of high risk conditions, gestational age, and other vital information necessary for successful pregnancy and birth. The use of portable ultrasound will transform health care in this region, with a drastic reduction in infant and maternal mortality.

story:
New and Unique! – We are very excited to unveil our latest design: a stunning pendant in sterling silver custom-made for you.

Rosalind Treasures™ offers the opportunity to keep your DNA in a circular-shaped pendant, made of resin encased in a ring of silver sterling pendant, covered with glass, with a 16 in. silver chain.

What is Rosalind Treasures™?  

Rosalind Treasures™ keepsake jewelry holds personal DNA as a beautiful, deeply personal souvenir. What if you could keep your loved one's DNA close to your heart? What if you could preserve your own DNA as a legacy?

Featuring a cool and modern design, the jewelry and products exhibit DNA in a attractive and accessible format. Inspired from the overwhelming beauty of life's essence, Rosalind Treasures™ creates unique and original keepsakes for everyone to enjoy.

Conscious of the importance of your loved ones in your personal life, Rosalind Treasure's now brings to you the possibility of preserving the DNA of someone close to you. DNA holds a very high symbolic value as it is synonymous with life itself. Every keepsake item created by Rosalind Treasure's is unique since the DNA of each individual is also unique. Our jewel, especially designed by an artisan for Rosalind Treasure's, contains the DNA you send us. Its circular casing echoes the biological cell, with DNA at its core, and will be able to travel through time to future generations.

The DNA is extracted from a simple buccal swab, sent by the client. During the preparation step, the individual's DNA is attached to a little charm, which is then encapsulated in resin to ensure its longevity. Our exclusive process also uses natural decorative DNA. When it is extracted from cells in high quantities, DNA adopts the white filamentous appearance of cotton. To improve the spectacular appearance of the jewel, the charm is enveloped in a cloud of decorative DNA. This decorative DNA will always be distinguishable from the your DNA as it comes from a species far removed from mammals. Decorative DNA comes in natural white or be colored to your liking (blue, red, green, etc.).

An original way to showcase DNA!

Rosalind Treasures™ offers the opportunity to keep your DNA in a circular-shaped pendant, made of resin encased in a ring of stainless steel, silver or gold colour-plated, with a 18 inch chain. You can select the colour for your DNA, from natural (white), blue, green or red.


Rosalind's unique process uses resin to protect and preserve the DNA, keeping it safe forever. The resin itself stunningly catches the light to showcase your DNA.

Why Rosalind Treasures™?

Rosalind Franklin was born in 1920. After receiving her Ph.D. from Cambridge in 1945, she worked as a research associate in London. In early 1951, she took the first X-ray diffraction photographs of DNA that showed a helical form of the molecule. Rosalind Franklin’s fundamental contribution to the discovery of DNA's double helix structure is now – finally – becoming more widely known.  The double helix is to science what the Mona Lisa is to painting.

The proprietary preparation process of Rosalind Treasures™

A key aspect of this unique concept is based on the amazing appearance of DNA, which adopts a white filamentous look when extracted from cells. It can then be coloured (blue, green, or red).

With our proprietary process, your personal DNA is attached to the unique charm and safely sealed in resin within the pendant. Your DNA is surrounded by a decorative coloured DNA.

What is decorative DNA? 

It refers to pure DNA molecules extracted from non-mammalian cells, that can be easily distinguished from your DNA by simple molecular biology techniques, when need be. 

How it works: 5 easy steps!

1)  You chose a perk on Indiegogo. (Perk: an advantage or extra thing, such as goods, that you are given because of your support to a project or a cause).

2)  We send you by mail the "DNA Collection Kit".

3)  You easily collect your DNA with a sterile cotton swab provided with the "DNA Collection Kit". The swab is rubbed in the inner cheek. Instructions are easy to follow. Don’t worry!

4)  Once you have collected your DNA, return your swab in a pre-addressed envelope to Rosalind Treasures™.  We will contact you to find out the colour of your choice and the type of charm you wish to have inserted in the pendant once the campaign ends.

5)  Once the Indiegogo campaign is over, we will start shipping your personal DNA keepsake pendant.

Allow 6-8 weeks for the delivery of your unique pendant.

How can DNA be seen in a pendant?

Thanks to Rosalind Treasures™ you can see DNA.

DNA, or deoxyribonucleic acid, contains the genetic information specific to each human. In other words, DNA is your unique signature in the universe. DNA is found inside nearly every cell of your body. In its natural form, DNA is not visible. Rosalind Treasures™ uses billions and billions of pure DNA molecules extracted from non-mammalian cells, through a well-established procedure, in order to make DNA visible. 

Rosalind Treasures™ will extract your DNA from your swab onto a tiny charm which is then inserted into the pendant.  Non-mammalian DNA is gently deposited side by side with your own DNA to magnify the effect.

Q & A

Since the DNA is a biological material, will it degrade over time in the pendant? 

Your DNA will be sealed in resin. It can last for centuries.

Is the pendant waterproof? 

The DNA in the pendant is water-soluble …but the resin makes it waterproof!

Will excessive light or sunlight alter the DNA?

No.

What currency is the contribution amount based on?

It is in Canadian dollars.

How do you ensure safe delivery of my item?

At the time of shipping, we will send a tracking code for your package.

We care about your privacy and security 

Our DNA preparation process is safe and secure.  We do not keep your DNA. It is all returned to you inserted into your new keepsake item. We follow security protocols protecting your personal data. Rosalind Treasures™ does not sample, sequence or analyse your DNA, nor do we keep your personal information. 

What happens if you lose your keepsake item?

If you ever lose your keepsake item, unfortunately you will have to follow the original purchasing and cheek swab collecting processes all over again, because we do not keep DNA samples …all your DNA is returned to you.

Who we are

The founders of Rosalind Treasures™ are committed to quality.  Let us introduce ourselves:

Dominique Bergeron, Ph.D. is the founder of Rosalind Treasures™. She has studied molecular biology extensively. 

Karl-Frederik Bergeron, Ph.D., nephew of Dr. Dominique Bergeron – is also a molecular biologist with a passion for the building blocks of life. 

Anne-Marie Larose, Ph.D., MBA, brings twenty years of diverse experience in the field of life science, combining both research and business aspects. 

Lucie E. Létourneau, MBA, PMP, is an enthusiastic business project management professional and she nourishes a passion for new technologies.

What have we achieved so far?

The DNA preparation process was developed by Dr. Bergeron, tested, optimized successfully and standardized respecting recognized protocols. We have developed prototypes and now we are ready to market!

Why crowdfunding?

Dr. Dominique Bergeron, with the help of Rosalind Treasures™, wants to bring an audacious idea to life …with your support and your faith. All the team members love science and new cool things and want to make people proud of their DNA.

Dr. Bergeron and her team want to bypass banks, venture capitalists and professional investors to create a business funding process based on real people, smiles, families, sensitivity, passion, love and friends.

We have overcome all the technical and scientific challenges! The remaining challenge is to get market support.

When introduced the Rosalind Treasures™ keepsake pendant to a trial group earlier this year, we received much supportive and positive feedback. In order to offer the Rosalind Treasures™ keepsake products to a wider audience, we need to set up a bigger lab infrastructure and initiate a marketing campaign. Crowdfunding will allow us to achieve these goals while respecting our beliefs.

Rosalind Treasures™ is ready to rock!

Contributors are at the heart of this project, as they will enable thousands of others to gain from keeping their DNA close to them, in a safe environment, while receiving their DNA keepsake item from Rosalind Treasures™ at a price significantly less than future retail price! 

What we need ...and what you'll get!

Most of your financial support will enable us to build up our full inventory and to finalize the setup of the laboratory equipment, such as the DNA Collection Kits necessary for the DNA sampling. 

Some of your financial support will also help us structure the website, fund the perks, expand our team and pay the Indiegogo processing fees. No salaries will be paid to the founding members. 


What if the Indiegogo financial goal is not reached?

In the event that we do not reach our stated goal, we will start off at a smaller scale. 

All the perks (Perk: an advantage or extra thing, such as goods, that you are given because of your support to a project or a cause) will be processed and delivered.

When can I expect my delivery?

Once the Indiegogo campaign is finished, we will start to process orders.

Our goal is delivering your perk (the awesome keepsake jewelry) to you 6-8 weeks after processing of your order. You can also expect to receive the gift card within one week of payment of the perk …so that you can give the best birthday / wedding / anniversary / Holiday gift ever!

Keep a memento of your loved one's uniqueness within your sight, by your side!

Anything helps!

If a financial contribution is not possible at this time, please share our project with your family and friends! 

Rosalind Treasures™ gives back! For every frame sent to the contributors through the perk which features the horse frame from the Indiegogo campaign, 20$ will be given back to a cause of your choice. 

The FEI World Equestrian Games™ are held every four years, in the middle of the Olympic cycle. The seven FEI disciplines – Jumping, Dressage and Para-Equestrian Dressage, Eventing, Driving, Endurance, Vaulting and Reining – are all included on the competition schedule.


Let's talk about your DNA! Choose the perk which fits your needs best!

Site under construction but soon to be rocking! http://www.rosalindstreasures.com/

«Can you imagine what scientists will have achieved in another 50 years from now? I suppose if there is something in my DNA that could potentially help my great-great-grand-kid, then I’m all for it! »

L. Tadros, Montreal, Canada.

story:
Full body portable exercise equipment that actually works.  


About Us
Christian Blaha the inventor of Xtreme Rollers, partnered with Manny Tafoya and John Santoliquido to bring to market his dream of a fluid full range of natural motion home exercise product. With years of exercise background, knowledge of the industry and unsurpassed drive, these three partners vision of one compact, affordable, full body exercise product has become a reality.
After multiple years of design changes, engineering updates and manufacturing issues, we have finally reached our goal to launch and bring Xtreme Rollers to market.

 

 

 

 

 

 

    •    International patent pending
    •    Order is in route from China
    •    Initial order placed.

A Little About the Xtreme Rollers Design:
We used the patented 9 omnidiresctional wheel design to make movements smooth and fluid while creating a stable surface for your body at all times. The 2 handed design frees up your arms and allows for full range-of-motion exercises usually only found in sports like rock climbing, swimming and yoga. Build strong flexible muscles while getting ripped abs.
With a quick click of the handle the inner strap and knee pad are revealed for lower body exercises. Tone glutes and legs while creating a lean sexy core at the same time.

What is included in the Xtreme Rollers retail package?
1 Pair of Xtreme Rollers, Instruction DVD, Knee Pad and Carry Bag.


What type of exercises can be performed with Xtreme Rollers?
The list would be too long to write them all down. Any exercise that can be done with a cable system, including yoga and pilates movements.


Where can Xtreme Rollers be used?
The robust design allows the Xtreme Rollers to be used on most surfaces including low pile carpet. A smooth clean surface works the best and some caution should be taken on hard wood floors.

Retail Box

story:
Twenty years ago I received the best news in my young life,“Welcome to remission, kiddo”.

The oncology doctor at Children's Hospital in Milwaukee knew the magnitude of those words. I am not sure I did. I was twelve years old and still pretty much in shock of the past year's events. The year prior, I was a typical 11 year old boy. Little league baseball and collecting baseball cards were my life. Something changed that summer, however. After all of my baseball games, it felt as though I had sprained my left ankle to the point I could not walk on it. Mom thought it was good idea to get it checked it out before we left for a vacation in August. The X-ray's showed something the doctors didn't like so I was immediately referred to a specialist.

The orthopedic surgeon we saw took one look at the X-ray and said it was cancer with such casualty it was hard to believe. After a second opinion we decided to take the advice and move fast with figuring out how bad it was. A week later I had a biopsy. A week after that I had my left leg amputated below the knee. One month from the amputation, I started chemo therapy for 10 months. It all happened so fast it was such a blur.

The good news for me was the doctors caught the cancer before it spread. Because we amputated it immediately, my life was saved. Many other kids that were going through similar circumstances were not so lucky. I was given a second chance. 

I am now 32 years old, healthy and happy and I feel like now is the right time to “pay it forward”. I have decided to ride my bicycle across the beautiful state of Wisconsin in hopes of raising $10,000 for the MACC fund. As a survivor of childhood cancer I feel like what they have done as an organization has helped me and thousands of other children defeat cancer and live a long, healthy life.

Joined by my brother, Jimmy, we are going to ride from the city of Milwaukee to La Crosse, WI, and back over a 5 day span from September 15th to the 19th. Going with the theme of paying it forward, we are going to “Cycle it Forward”.

-Jon Finiak

story:
Jamie Griffith

This guy is one of a kind.  He can cut up and be cheerful even in the darkest times.  He was diagnosed with ALS in August 2011.  In the beginning the doctors thought he had a stroke but after several tests it was confirmed -- ALS, the silent killer. 

Jamie and his family were friends with us before we even realized we were family.  After about 3 years of friendship we both mentioned that we were attending a family reunion the same weekend and come to find out -- Jamie's wife and my husband Shane were distant cousins.  Small world! 

Finding out we were family just made us closer and Jamie's kids and our son were best friends.  Jamie and his wife Kathy are more than just people, they are truly special to us and a lot of others.  This couple gives until they can't give.  Always working to help others or to provide more for others than themselves.  Jamie is a very humorous guy that never quits smiling.  Kathy is very laid back and tries to handle every bump in the road.  But now this couple is facing a very hard spot in their lives together.  ALS has snuck in and is stealing their special time together.  Jamie is no longer able to feed himself nor any other functions that involve the use of his hands.  He is not able to walk and is starting to have difficulty breathing. 

The family has been barely making the payments on their everyday bills and has even gotten behind on a few of them.  They are now in need of a cargo van to transport Jamie.  The motorized scootor that they were able to get is unable to be transported with the vehicle they have now. 

Jamie and Kathy has worked hard all their lives.  Jamie never missed work and was able to roll over his months of vacation time for this hardship.  It has now ran out.  Kathy use to work 2 jobs and is now barely able to work part time.  She is his everything.  They are losing their home that they have worked so hard to keep.  Renovations are needed to this home for Jamie's accessabilty.  This costs a lot!  I am being very conservative on funds that are needing to be raised.  But every bit will help. 

They need a Cargo Van

They are in need of a Cargo Van with the lifting equiptment to transport a wheelchair and Jamie.

  • This family needs at least $4000 to purchase the van.
  • Any extra funds that are raised will be greatly appreciated and be used to pay past due bills and any maintenance/insurance on the van.
  • If the funds are not raised in full... they will still be used to make a downpayment on the van or pay medical bills.

The Impact

I have seen Jamie help out quite a few people and it would be nice to see others come to his rescue in his time of need.  He may only be here for a short period of time and I would like to see him enjoy every minute that is left of it.  He and his family should not have to stress so much over bills during these rough times.

Other Ways You Can Help

Send him a cheerful card to help keep his spirits raised:

Jamie Griffith

409 Saint Anthony Drive

Lexington, KY  40505

 

Connect with him on Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/JamieGriffithAlsSupport?ref=hl

 

Please share with others.

story:
A friend from Russia has reached out to me asking for help. The family just learned that their six month old son Stanislav Shpannikov was diagnosed with deadly emerging biliary cirrhosis associated with anemia. Stanislav cannot get the necessary treatment in Russia and must have a surgery in a specialized hospital in Belgium. The donor for the liver transplant will be the mother of the baby. The total cost of the treatment is EUR103,000. Needless to say, the amount of money is enormous, especially for an average family in Russia. I launched this fund to raise money with the help of my friends and colleagues from all over the world. Please join me in this effort by spreading the word within your community.

Every donation counts. We need to collect most  amount of money by April 23rd.

story:
Karen McCarthy has recently been diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma with a grading of 2.5 (1 being slowest growing, 3 being fastest).

Karen is a mother of five children who are all enrolled in or have graduated from the Penfield and Mercy school districts.

Her husband, Sean, is a lifelong resident of the Rochester area.

While nursing Karen’s newest addition to her family , 6-month-old Quinn (upper left), she noticed a lump under her breast.  Just after Christmas, it seemed larger.  After visits with multiple OB/GYN, family physicians, and cancer experts, Karen learned of her diagnosis, chose a course for treatment, and is surging forward with great optimism and unreal energy.

Karen’s children, Riley (20), Amy (18), Patrick (11), Daniel (9) and Quinn are her inspiration in her battle with the disease. To help Karen keep up on her daily duties as a mother, a fundraiser is being organized to help with costs for treatment, child care, transportation, out-of-town lodging expenses while seeking consultations, meals, over-the-counter medications not covered by insurance, parking and transportation expenses, and prescriptions.

 Other Ways to Help:

Attend a fundraiser with food, raffles and a silent auction on May 11th, 2013, starting at 4 p.m., at Johnny's Irish Pub:


1382 Culver Rd.  Rochester, NY

story:
Summary

I'm a transgendered individual who needs a little help raising funds for a surgery that will greatly improve my self image and mental well being.

  • Hi all, my name is Jamie French. I'm a 34 year old transgendered person living in North Texas.
  • I'm seeking financial assistance for a medical procedure.
  • All contributions are greatly appreciated and will be reward with "perks".

What I Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I'm trying to raise approximately $5500 within 60 days, every dime of which will go straight to my surgeon.
  • I'm offering "perks" for contributions... the more generous the donation, the more substantial the "perk".
  • My surgeon will take any amount I give him to hold on to until I've reached the total price of the procedure so every donations counts whether or not I reach my goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Help spread the word through Twitter, Facebook, or any other networking site.
  • Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools in order to help spread the word!
